info.title: Formance Stack API
info.description:
Open, modular foundation for unique payments flows

# Introduction
This API is documented in **OpenAPI format**.

# Authentication
Formance Stack offers one forms of authentication:
  - OAuth2
OAuth2 - an open protocol to allow secure authorization in a simple
and standard method from web, mobile and desktop applications.
<SecurityDefinitions />

organization.description: The organization on which the ledger is located

post.summary: Add a secret to a client

delete.summary: Delete a secret from a client

delete.description: Delete a transient scope from a scope

get.description: List users
Read user

head.summary: Count the accounts from a ledger

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Filter accounts by address pattern (regular expression placed between ^ and $).

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Filter accounts by metadata key value pairs. The filter can be used like this metadata[key]=value1&metadata[a.nested.key]=value2

get.description: List accounts from a ledger, sorted by address in descending order.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Filter accounts by address pattern (regular expression placed between ^ and $).

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Filter accounts by metadata key value pairs. Nested objects can be used as seen in the example below.

parameters.name: balance
parameters.description: Filter accounts by their balance (default operator is gte)

parameters.name: balanceOperator
parameters.description: Operator used for the filtering of balances can be greater than/equal, less than/equal, greater than, less than, equal or not.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
Parameter used in pagination requests. Maximum page size is set to 15.
Set to the value of next for the next page of results.
Set to the value of previous for the previous page of results.
No other parameters can be set when this parameter is set.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description:
Exact address of the account. It must match the following regular expressions pattern:
```
^\w+(:\w+)*$
```

parameters.name: address
parameters.description:
Exact address of the account. It must match the following regular expressions pattern:
```
^\w+(:\w+)*$
```

parameters.name: dryRun
parameters.description: Set the dry run mode. Dry run mode doesn't add the logs to the database or publish a message to the message broker.

get.description: Get statistics from a ledger. (aggregate metrics on accounts and transactions)

head.summary: Count the transactions from a ledger

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Filter transactions with postings involving given account, either as source or destination (regular expression placed between ^ and $).

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filter transactions with postings involving given account at source (regular expression placed between ^ and $).

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Filter transactions with postings involving given account at destination (regular expression placed between ^ and $).

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description:
Filter transactions that occurred after this timestamp.
The format is RFC3339 and is inclusive (for example, "2023-01-02T15:04:01Z" includes the first second of 4th minute).

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description:
Filter transactions that occurred before this timestamp.
The format is RFC3339 and is exclusive (for example, "2023-01-02T15:04:01Z" excludes the first second of 4th minute).

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Filter transactions by metadata key value pairs. Nested objects can be used as seen in the example below.

requestBody.description:
The request body must contain at least one of the following objects:
  - `postings`: suitable for simple transactions
  - `script`: enabling more complex transactions with Numscript

Reset a connector by its name.
It will remove the connector and ALL PAYMENTS generated with it.

get.description: Sorted by updated date descending

post.description:
Insert a new webhooks config.

The endpoint should be a valid https URL and be unique.

The secret is the endpoint's verification secret.
If not passed or empty, a secret is automatically generated.
The format is a random string of bytes of size 24, base64 encoded. (larger size after encoding)

All eventTypes are converted to lower-case when inserted.

delete.description: Delete a webhooks config by ID.

get.description: Test a config by sending a webhook to its endpoint.

put.description: Activate a webhooks config by ID, to start receiving webhooks to its endpoint.
Deactivate a webhooks config by ID, to stop receiving webhooks to its endpoint.

put.summary: Change the signing secret of a config
put.description:
Change the signing secret of the endpoint of a webhooks config.

If not passed or empty, a secret is automatically generated.
The format is a random string of bytes of size 24, base64 encoded. (larger size after encoding)

reference.description: Reference to attach to the generated transaction

pollingPeriod.description: The frequency at which the connector will try to fetch new BalanceTransaction objects from Stripe API.

pageSize.description: Number of BalanceTransaction to fetch at each polling interval.

filePollingPeriod.description: The frequency at which the connector will try to fetch new payment objects from the directory

fileGenerationPeriod.description: The frequency at which the connector will create new payment objects in the directory

loginID.description: Username of the API Key holder

pollingPeriod.description: The frequency at which the connector will fetch transactions

endpoint.description: The endpoint to use for the API. Defaults to https://devapi.currencycloud.com

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a transfer object.
It can be useful for storing additional information about the transfer in a structured format.

asset.description: The asset of the monetary value.

amount.description: The amount of the monetary value.

id.description: The unique ID of the wallet.
The unique ID of the wallet.
The unique ID of the hold.

walletID.description: The ID of the wallet the hold is associated with.

metadata.description: Custom metadata to attach to this wallet.

final.description: Define a final confirmation. Remaining funds will be returned to the wallet.

pending.description: Set to true to create a pending hold. If false, the wallet will be debited immediately.

PageSize.name: pageSize
PageSize.description: The maximum number of results to return per page.

Cursor.name: cursor
Cursor.description:
Parameter used in pagination requests. Maximum page size is set to 15.
Set to the value of next for the next page of results.
Set to the value of previous for the previous page of results.
No other parameters can be set when this parameter is set.

Sort.name: sort
Sort.description: Fields used to sort payments (default is date:desc).
